      • newRule

        public void newRule(java.util.List<java.lang.String> permittedPurpose,
                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> excludedPurpose,
                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> permittedUtilizer,
                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> excludedUtilizer,
                    java.util.List<Transformation> transformation)
        Adds a new rule to the policy.
        Parameters:
        permittedPurpose - A list of permitted purposes.
        excludedPurpose - A list of excluded purposes.
        permittedUtilizer - A list of permitted utilizers.
        excludedUtilizer - A list of excluded utilizers.
        transformation - A list of transformations in the rule.

      • getTrRules

        public java.util.List<Rule> getTrRules()
        Returns all transformation rules available in the policy. Looks for transformations in active rules only.
        Returns:
        A list of Rule objects with the permitted utilizers, purposes and transformations.

      • archiveRule

        public void archiveRule(int ruleId)

        Parameters:

      • updateRule

        public void updateRule(int ruleId,
                       java.util.List<java.lang.String> permittedPurpose,
                       java.util.List<java.lang.String> excludedPurpose,
                       java.util.List<java.lang.String> permittedUtilizer,
                       java.util.List<java.lang.String> excludedUtilizer,
                       java.util.List<Transformation> transformation)
        Updates a rule and its properties.
        Parameters:
        ruleId - The id of the rule to update.
        permittedPurpose - The permitted purposes in the updated rule.
        excludedPurpose - The excluded purposes in the updated rule.
        permittedUtilizer - The permitted utilizers in the updated rule.
        excludedUtilizer - The excluded utilizers in the updated rule.
        transformation - The transformations in the updated rule.

      • isPurposeAllowed

        public boolean isPurposeAllowed(java.lang.String purpose)
        For a given purpose, it checks whether it is included in any of the exclusions.
        Parameters:
        purpose - The purpose to check.
        Returns:
        Whether the purpose is permitted and not included in any of the exclusions.

      • getPurpose

        public Purpose getPurpose()
        Returns all permitted and excluded purposes from the active rules.
        Returns:
        A Purpose object with all permitted and excluded purposes from the rules.

      • getUtilizer

        public Utilizer getUtilizer()
        Returns all permitted and excluded utilizers from all the active rules.
        Returns:
        A Utilizer object with all rules' permitted and excluded utilizers.
